context:
Wow. When I was a kid the only views of Neptune were fuzzy blobs and those were taken with the then state-of-the-art Hale telescope.  
These are astonishing accomplishments by teams of mostly unknown engineers and technicians. 
kudos to them all.

She wept when she saw the rings!  I can only imagine!  I think it’s thrilling and awe inspiring to witness these kind of things.  It makes me think about how small we are in the big picture, which to me, is comforting.
infrared images??? i would rather see it as it is to our eyes..
